column4: in that case you could do a server install, enable universe and multiverse repos, and then sudo apt-get install fluxbox
source-o-matic should help you out with generating an appropriate sources.list with universe and multiverse repos enabled
short simple instructions
install dapper server cd, then go 'sudo apt-get fluxbox'
pretty darn easy
um, yeah... thanks for the try
oh well. worth a shot
oh hey mabus
how are things going?
Good, good.
got through with flubuntu and whatnot?
Just did a ubuntu server + LAMP + flux
Out of curiosity - if you ran Gentoo before, why don't you make your own distro or something?
I made my own distro once for learning how linux ticks
Hmm, maybe I should.
I just have so much stuff to learn... I have a membership to bitme, and more ebooks than I could read in a lifetime.
whatever I've done on it so far is not too impressive though. I need to mount virtual kernel filesystems via a livecd and then run it
It's hard to decide what to learn at any given point.
and then again, all my text based distro can really do at the moment is just extract bzip2 and gzip tarballs and compile C and C++ source code
I work on developing it every now and then. Maybe soon one day it'll have X and GNOME when it's ready.
or X and Xfce. or X and KDE. or X and Flux. I still don't know what to choose lol
Maybe I could help you out with it sometime?
